newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: Swiss churches will help needy Jewish families.
newsitem.headline: Swiss churches will help needy Jewish families.

text.p: Swiss churches will distribute around 270,000 Swiss francs ($195,000) in donations they have collected to needy Jewish families in Bulgaria, Russia, Israel and Switzerland, organisers said on Friday.

Stung by accusations that Switzerland coolly profited from World War Two and that Swiss banks hoarded unclaimed accounts of Holocaust victims, the religious groups began to solicit donations in early February, the SDA news agency said.
Two other private donation drives are also under way, one launched by Bernese school children and another by a member of Switzerland's upper house of parliament.
They are separate from a 265 million Swiss franc Holocaust memorial fund being financed by donations from banks, private businesses and Switzerland's central bank.
Organisers of the church fund said they had a list of 30 to 50 families in Switzerland and Bulgaria who could get donations. They were still waiting for candidates in Israel and Russia.
